result.execSummary:
The defendant Corithein D Broughton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Imposed and Stayed. Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3 1/2 years bifurcated sentence.
Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is ordered to pay restitution during the pendancy of probation.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Do not drive unless properly licensed. Follow the rules at home including curfew. Write a letter of apology to the victim and turn it into the agent. No contact with the victim or the co defendants (person, property, residence or family). Be involved in cognitive thinking. Pay outstanding ZCI fees. Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.
Court costs are waived. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.

timeConds.notes: STAYED. Credit for time served only to be applied if revoked.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Corithein D Broughton in court with attorney Brett A Ekes.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
BTC: 
Count 1- 3 1/2 Years WPS, 1 1/2 Years init, 2 Years es, i/s, 2 Years probation

Conditions:
90 days RCJ - stayed
Credit for time served to be applied only if revoked
Do not drive unless properly licensed
Follow the rules at home including curfew
Write a letter of apology to the victim and turn it into the agent
Complete 20 hours community service work
Pay restitution in the amount of $100, to be joint and several
Provide a DNA Sample + pay a surcharge
Court costs are waived
No contact with the victim or the co defendants 
Be involved in cognitive therapy
Obtain High School Diploma
No drugs, no alcohol
Pay outstanding ZCI fees

CO-SIGNED BY MOTHER, SHERIKA COLE. 
Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.    No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family). LAF & WBY   No contact with the co-defendant. KH & DP   Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions would be going to court and meeting with atty.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
